required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Factors in Pregnant Women With COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: COVID-19 is a disease whose development, prognosis mechanism and immune status are still unknown. The aim of the study is to determine the relationship between clinical and laboratory data and the severity of the disease by evaluating the hematological and radiological features of the patients. The secondary aim is to determine the predictive values of clinical and laboratory data for the severity of COVID-19.

primary_outcome.measure: the factors affecting prognosis in pregnant women diagnosed with COVID-19

intervention.description: PCR and CT results, hemogram, urea, creatinine, AST, ALT, LDH, D-Dimer, ferritin, lipase, amylase, CRP, procalcitonin, albumin, total protein, coagulation tests-PT, APTT, Fibrinogen-, Troponin T, CK , electrolytes, blood gas, bilirubins

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being pregnant with a diagnosis of COVID-19 between the ages of 18-45
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected COVID-19 diagnosis

facility.name: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Specialist of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Principal Investigator
